data.meta_description: | Gun store, Range, Classes, Tactical Training, Uniforms, Barber shop, Molly Pitchers restaurant
data.text:
Our Practical Pistol Classes Are Back For September

Practical Pistol 1 - For the person who has a Concealed Pistol License (CPL) and is looking to improve their weapon handling and shooting skills. Skills focused on include: holster draw, smooth presentation, precision shooting from varying distances along with speed reloading, and stoppage clearing.

Practical Pistol 2 - Will provide shooters the skills to acquire a target faster and learn the technique of target focus shooting (keeping both eyes open). Instructor addresses proper grip, smooth presentation, shooting stance, trigger control, clearing stoppages, and scanning for possible threats.

Practical Pistol 3 - Will assist the student in faster target acquisition, use of target focus shooting, and incorporate movement during shooting. This follow-up course to Practical Pistol 2 takes what you learned and incorporates moving while shooting. Students will start with lateral movement, and progress to advancing and rearward movement.

Practical Pistol 4 - Explores target acquisition, target focused shooting, tactical movement, and shooting at multiple targets. This is a follow-up course to Practical Pistol 3, reviews what you learned, and further develops movement while shooting at multiple targets.

Practical Pistol 5 - Provides instruction on shooting a handgun with one hand while using proper positioning, grip, stance, and body dynamics. This course enables the student to shoot both dominant and non-dominant hand, and the use of forward and lateral shooting positions. Students will learn the marksmanship style of shooting and advance into target focus shooting.

Practical Pistol 6 - Explores how to shoot a handgun while holding a flashlight in the non-dominant hand while using proper shooting positioning, grip, stance, and body dynamics. The techniques taught include; Ayoob Hold, Harries Hold, and FBI Modified Hold. Some of these techniques also applies when holding a cellular telephone (calling the Police).

Each class length is 3 hours and costs $60 each.
